Select Hotel Berlin The Wall
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 861 reviews

I genuinely don't think I could have found a more ideal hotel to use as a base for our first visit to the city of Berlin.

Located just 1 minute's walk away from the famous Checkpoint Charlie interchange on Friedrichstraße and Zimmerstraße, the location of the hotel is perfect for those wishing to explore the city. Just behind the Checkpoint is the Kochstraße U-Bahn station on the U6 line of Berlin's excellent public transport system. From here, you can reach almost all areas of Berlin, and changing lines or transport methods (S-Bahn, Bus or Tram) is simple and painless. The Hotel is modern, fresh and incredibly clean. The rooms are very stylish and the bed is perfect to rest your weary legs and back after a long day exploring. Being a city hotel, the views will not be spectacular, but the large windows let in lots of natural light. My only criticism would be the lack of drink-making facilities. A coffee in the morning would've made things just that little bit more perfect. The hotel itself is quiet and the staff are very attentive and helpful. The free WiFi throughout was a very welcome feature, helping us to plan each day perfectly. We didn't have the hotel breakfast, preferring to venture out in the city to try different things each day. All in all, this was the perfect place to stay and the next time I visit Berlin, I won't be looking anywhere else!

Show more
Roberto , United Kingdom
Leonardo Royal Hotel Berlin Alexanderplatz
8.7 Excellent
Based on 1480 reviews

Sooo I did a lot of research on this hotel before I booked. My boyfriend picked me up from Schönefeld Airport and it was about 3 stops on the RE train which took 20 minutes.

The walk from Alexanderplatz station to the hotel is 10-15 minutes which was totally fine. When we got to the hotel it was like 3:30pm and our room wasn't ready so they directed us to the bar for some free drinks. Check-in was speedy no issues, we asked for a late check out which they said was unavailable (we asked different staff the next day and it was magically available to us then). We booked a Junior Suite, I thought it would be bigger than what we stayed in but it was fine and spacious enough. I think the hotel slyly use "Deluxe Triple Room" and "Junior Suite" interchangeably because if you go through the pics on their website and elsewhere you'll notice they're basically exactly the same. We even checked the sofa to see if it opens up into a bed and it does so erm yeah lol! (I'm picky like that). I actually went back to tell them they gave us a deluxe room instead and they said "Nope it's definitely a Junior Suite". Our rooms had the usual tea/coffee machine, robes, slippers and little cosmetics in the bathroom. Massive queen bed. We didn't eat at the hotel as it's right next to Alexanderplatz so we wanted to explore. Oh and the church bells... My God the bells!!! I had read about them being rung super early, I even requested to be away from them beforehand but unfortunately we were right opposite. On the first night they rang around 6am and me and my boyfriend couldn't stop laughing as this is what the majority of reviews had complained about. Overall it's a good hotel. Close enough to Alexanderplatz, the trains and trams. I would definitely come back.

Show more
Theophania , United Kingdom
Select Hotel Berlin Checkpoint Charlie
8.3 Excellent
Based on 277 reviews

We had a very good stay overall. All staff members were courteous and professional. The hotel´s location in a quiet street is OK because tourist attractions are within easy and convenient reach either on foot or public transportation.

All 4 floors of the property are non-smoking. Our standard room was comfortable and adequately spacious, and so was the bathroom. The room had a closet of good size and safety-deposit box. We enjoyed the flat-screen TV. We missed amenities like complimentary water or coffee, though. When we made our booking, we requested early check-in because we arrived early in the morning from Mexico City. We did not have good fortune with our request, but we left our luggage in a storage room and went out to enjoy the day. In general, we found this hotel to be a nice value-for-money option and will surely consider it again when we return to Berlin!

Show more
Gunther , Mexico
Select Hotel Berlin Gendarmenmarkt
8.3 Excellent
Based on 440 reviews

I arrived on July 28th, 2015 for one day. Check-in was a breeze. I didn't realize that in order to use an elevator I had to scan my hotel card.

Itd be nice if I was told that at the desk. I also was clueless how to open the door. I didn't realize you need to lean the card on the black round circle thingy under the lock. It seems to me that Europeans think one should know these things on its own while North Americans guide you thru everything like you are a child with special needs. Not sure which is better. Room was clean, sheets were clean and crisp. I used to work in housekeeping so I check my rooms thoroughly. There was a some kind of paper under my bed. I couldn't reach it to have it removed. When I was checking out the girl at the desk spoke limited English and asked "So, its okay?". The usual question is: "How was your stay?" I said "Ok." and then there was silence when I didn't clue in that I can go. I also didn't get a print out of my receipt. Saying something like: "I hope you enjoyed your stay and have a great day!" would be better. These are all small things that could be easily improved. One of the girls working at the desk (tall, skinny, ponytail and glasses) was quite helpful and capable. Your employees are good. Itd be nice if their level of spoken English was a bit better considering its a centrally located hotel in a big city. I hate to sound like an ignorant North American but English has sadly or not unofficially taken over No.1 language. And this is coming from a non-native English speaker. If your staff could suggest local attractions, restaurants and coffee shops itd be great. I was very happy with my stay and would definitely stay at your hotel again!

Show more
Dragana , Canada
Park Inn by Radisson Berlin Alexanderplatz
7.8 Very good
Based on 672 reviews

Ms Fahmy, the receptionist was very friendly and helpful when I arrived from a long haul flight. Check in was prompt and I had immediate access to my room.

I requested a late check in and they were very accommodating. On the downside, the hotel does not offer free internet, a porter service or free breakfast. The hotel entrance feels like a public thoroughfare and a bit uncomfortable. My room was cozy, with newish bathroom fittings in good condition. However the carpets was really old with stains along the corridors - not great if you suffer from allergies. I woke up with a blocked nose. Due to a Mis understanding at checkin about my request for a late check out, the cleaning staff knocked repeatedly on my door and I was rudely instructed to check out. No polite greeting or polite questions about my check out time. This was underscored by the presence of what appeared to be two big men in suits waiting outside my room by next to the lift lobby. I was given 10minutes to vacate my room at 3.25pm (I was under the impression that I could stay until 4pm and u was not informed of what procedures to take to ensure that this could happen, other than the fact that I would pay an additional 25euros). I did not receive a call from reception to clarify this nor was I given the opportunity to call reception either. I found the cleaning staff utterly and completely rude. I was made to feel like a criminal and i felt unwelcome. The menacing presence of those two men in the lift lobby was intimidating and I was made to feel like a criminal, simply because of a misunderstanding at check in. This was horrible experience and I will never stay here again. Noting my distress at check out, ms Reception kindly waived my surcharge and explained that it was a misunderstanding, however this does not excuse or justify rudeness from a chambermaid. Unacceptable.

Show more
Mpho , South Africa
Novum Hotel Aldea Berlin Zentrum
7.5 Very good
Based on 317 reviews

however, there's no air conditioning in the room, and when the windows are opened to circulate the air, bug will fly in and settle on the table top and surfaces.

With the traffic noise coming from the street and the metro, it can be quite a challenge to get to sleep. The lighting is dim, and for an Asian girl, the bathroom mirror was way too high, and that's the only mirror in the room. Bathroom is very spacious though. Overall, the place is clean and convenient, located between 2 metro stations, not too far from Berlin hbf station and there are many food choices about 2 and half blocks from the hotel.

Show more
chui , Singapore
The Weinmeister Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 179 reviews

Arrived very late on a Sunday. Was helped quickly and efficiently. Bigger room than expected. 1/2 hour after entering room and settling in, a group of young adults arrived next door, screaming, yelling, banging, crashing.

Proceeded to turn on a very loud sound system, practically sounded like a center city dance club !! I got dressed, went down to the lobby, complained of the issue. Front desk staff quickly took care of the problem. Closed down the dance club in a jiffy. Thanks for that! Great hot shower ! This is the 3rd time in 2 weeks I have stayed at this location - I stayed in a single room 1st time on a lower floor, it was buggy, noticed small slow moving bugs on and around my bed. 2nd time was fine and the last stay was last night (see above) Not sure if I would stay here again ... it definately wouldn't be my first choice.

Show more
HENRY , United States
Estrel Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 306 reviews

The hotel is the biggest in Germany. So it's over the top large with conference halls, its own restaurants, and performing venue.

The weekend we stayed there was a huge convention on. It's a nice enough hotel but the location is shocking. 8kms out of the city and the local area is terrible. A train station is close by, which is good, but once you cross under the tracks you feel like you've arrived at the wrong end of town. I felt completely unsafe after nightfall and during the day the area had many drunks walking around. If you're looking to immerse yourself in the Berlin culture, eat local food, close to sights, then this is not the place. We changed hotels (we only booked two nights here just in case, I could have left after one but had already paid). We got a different hotel in a much nicer location (between Ostbahnhof and Friedrichshain) to complete our Berlin visit. If you are happy getting a cab to and from the hotel, then the hotel is good otherwise steer clear. You'll enjoy Berlin much more being somewhere else.

Show more
Kane , Australia
Titanic Chaussee Berlin
9 Excellent
Based on 150 reviews

Titanic Chaussee is the place to book if you want a downtown location. All transit systems are within 2 blocks.

It is a very eclectic part of Berlin with many varied food choices nearby-which is a good thing because restaurants and food services at the hotel are very expensive. If you are travelling on an business expense account then use the hotel facilities, if you are travelling on your own money there are unlimited places to eat at 1/2 the cost. The room was very modern, well appointed with a very comfortable bed. The washroom was well stocked and had a walk-in shower. We stayed four nights and I don't think our bedding was changed (although the hotel information book said bedding was changed every second night). There were also two very obvious (small) pieces of garbage around the bed that were still there when we checked out. WiFi in the rooms was adequate although every time it was used the full login procedure had to be repeated. Overall 4 out of 5 stars.

Show more
Paul , Canada
Angleterre Hotel Berlin
8.4 Excellent
Based on 255 reviews

i stayed at angleterre for the full 12 nights while in berlin. i was given exactly what i was expecting, clean room (smoking) which allowed me a check in time at 3pm which was okay.

decent windows in the room for good ventilation. the television has all the free/cable channels when i felt bored. housekeeping is efficient and supplies replenished every day. the only thing that bothered me at certain times, was the slight odour emitting from the bathroom, not so much a big deal as shutting the door kept it in (i guess to get it fixed, the room will have to be vacated for major plumbing works and it was bearable and i was only in the room in the evenings, so no big complains about it)- the best thing i like of the hotel is, its just opposite or adjacent to coffee shops for breakfast, lunch & dinners for very affordable prices. convenience shops are just adjacent for train tickets, also a 2nd-hand shop nearby for more affordable materials i.e garments/books etc.

Show more
Audrey , Malaysia
Titanic Gendarmenmarkt Berlin Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 119 reviews

Firstly, let me start with a small disappointment. The curtain in my room (#305) was defect and had shoe marks all over.

That kind of marred a perfect score if I were to rate this hotel. The other was the inconsistency in the toilettries where some days they were replenished and anothe day-not. Now back to the positives- 1) the room was neat and new with a wonderful view of the street; 2) the interior and furnishing were fairly modern; equipped with a Samsung tablet for guidance on the hotel's offerings; 3) breakfast (if purchased with the room) was really pleasant and adequate; not too much nor too little in terms of variety and scrumptious. The servers were also very attentive ensuring my coffee and water was ready as soon as I sat down-amazing!; 4) location-superb; near top shopping malls and if you needed a taxi, easily obtainable; 5) best of all- the staff were world class. I have stayed in well known hotels and the personnel at the Titanic Deluxe (fr the concierge to the reception, to the waiter/waitress, manager and even the chambermaids/cleaners) were all exceptional in character. The one other hotel that was close was a well known one in Hong Kong. Everyone I met there was so willing to help, was courteous, patient and went all the way in ensuring my stay was a pleasant and memorable one. My luggage unfortunately did not make it to Berlin the same day I arrived but 3 days later. The staff at Titanic Deluxe made such an effort to stay on hold with the airlines everyday to find out the status of my luggage. When it arrived, it was whisked straight to my room. I noticed the hotel is also extremely sensitive towards the needs of the physically challenged or aged. So I will recommend this place for those having a need for wheelchair access and handrails, etc. Well, suffice to say, I will definitely consider staying here again in future. It certainly felt like home away from home for me.

Show more
Gladys , Malaysia
Vienna House Andel’s Berlin
8.4 Excellent
Based on 109 reviews

Overall good stay. A few issues - The pillows were too soft. It wasn't made clear to us that breakfast was till 10.

30 on weekdays and 1 on weekends. The way we were informed about this, we thought that some items would not be available after 10.30 but we could still have breakfast till 1pm on all days. We had breakfast at about 1045 am on Sunday but when we arrived on Monday staff were taking the food away and we had to eat outside. Also, being visitors from the UK, it came as a surprise to know that no clothes /swimwear at all were allowed in the mixed sauna area. However they are allowed in the whirlpool/steam areas but this was not made clear to us by the staff until we asked local guests.The steam room had very little steam as well.

Show more
anirban , India
Sheraton Berlin Grand Hotel Esplanade
8.5 Excellent
Based on 62 reviews

Not a great view. Right in front of residences building. But a great location. Perfect for walks around and very easily accessible by bus etc.

Bt we were driving so parking was too expensive at 20 euro a night. And wifi is 3 or 4 euro for 15 minutes. So that was really a downside. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Also found the bathrooms to be nice. Fairly new looking hotel. With Harry new York Bar downstairs. Would recommend if you don't drive or don't mind parking outside. And if wifi isn't a matter for you ( international tourists beware )

Show more
Jessica , Mongolia
The Mandala Hotel
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 67 reviews

Stayed at this beautiful hotel for 3 nights following a recommendation from a friend! We weren't disappointed! Easy check in friendly staff beautiful design! Upgraded to an executive suite which was fabulous plenty of space felt more like an apartment! Breakfast had plenty to offer for all tastes! Central location directly opposite the Sony Center! Easy walking distance to all the major attractions although the transport links are very good! I'd recommend walking if able to get a real feeling for the city! Shopping complexes nearby looked amazing although we didn't have time to experience any of them! Have read numerous uncomplimentary reviews, however, we wouldn't hesitate to stay again!

Carol , United Kingdom
NH Collection Berlin Mitte Friedrichstrasse
8.6 Excellent
Based on 186 reviews

i have arrived to the hotel at 9:30 am and immediately got into my room. the hotel has great location near s-bahn (direct train from sxf airport), u-bahn stations and walking distance from unter der linden street.

the room was very clean and big enough. our window was pointed to the train station direction, but with closed window, we didn't hear any noise from the station.

Show more
Alexey , Israel
Swissotel Berlin Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 303 reviews

the hotel is very conveniently located in the downtown area, with easy access to the metro system and bus from the airport.

we were denied check-in when we arrived at the hotel at 0300 pm, the stated check-in time. i guess it's because the hotel is fully booke for a quick shower as we were extremely tired after a long-haul flight. fair enough. nothing to complain thoughd. we were offered free breakfast the next morning as a compensation and hotel staff took us to the gym bath room what we had expected at the beginning was our own shower room. the breakfast was good. definitely worth the money. overall a very pleasant stay at the hotel. will stay here again if come back to berlin.

Show more
chuang , Taiwan
Hilton Berlin Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 230 reviews

This hotel is in a great location with lots of restaurants, cafes, bakeries and shops just outside its doors.

The "hop on hop off" city tour buses all stop just a block away. There is also an underground train station in front of the hotel. From here we were able to walk to the Brandenberg gate in about 15 minutes and have a great day on foot seeing all the museams and sights on our list. we were also able to walk across the river to museam island and some great neighbourhood shopping. The hotel staff were great and the room was nice with an updated bathroom. Wifi is not free but that seems standard in Germany. You can tell alot about a hotel by what the staff does when something goes wrong and when the power and water had to be shut off they took such great care of us and truely understood the level of inconvienience. The restaurant attached is really nice and it was our best meal in berlin! can't recomend the location or the hotel more!

Show more
Catherine , Canada
DORMERO Hotel Berlin Ku’damm
8.5 Excellent
Based on 167 reviews

We really enjoyed our visit to the Dormero hotel. Decor is very tasteful and the location is perfect for sight seeing.

The hotel is situated in a very quiet side street. So peaceful and quiet particularly at night. Staff are very helpful and were very efficient in sorting a couple of minor issues. Like a lot of hotels in Berlin the Dormero doesn't provide tea and coffee facilities in their rooms which we personally would have liked. We would have no hesitation in returning to the Dormero in the future.

Show more
Jane , United Kingdom
Select Hotel Berlin Ostbahnhof
8.2 Excellent
Based on 124 reviews

had a very interesting stay at the innside hotel everything was as you would expect from a german hotel very efficient well organised well planned friendly staff the hotel is not in the centre of berlin and there are not many good places to eat close by so you have to catch the train the station is just around the corner which is handy i would give a glowing reveiw for this hotel but for one factor the pillows they were like a peice of doona 90 cm square very strange may seem picky but when i went to recepyion to get another pillow to at least get my head off the bed i was told everyone complaiins about the pillows? why dont they do something about it then have travelled all over the world but didnt sleep well all week we were there

Gregory , Australia
Novum Hotel City B Berlin Centrum
8 Very good
Based on 192 reviews

The hotel is located near to central Berlin and directly adjacent to an U-Bahn station making it very convenient.

In fact I spent only one night in Berlin on this trip having a flight to catch in the morning and was quite surprised at how easy it was to get from the hotel to Tegel airport. My room had a double bed, and unlike most hotels I've stayed in Germany it was a real double, not simply two singles pushed together. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. I was on the third floor facing the main street and the U-bahn station, but it was still quiet. The bathroom was very spacious. Overall I would return to this hotel. I cannot comment on the food as I did not have breakfast,if personal ratings are included with this comment please ignore the rating I gave food/dining, the website would not allow me to submit a review without entering a value.

Show more
Hart , Canada
H10 Berlin Ku'damm Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 289 reviews

We stayed in the H10 hotel over NYE in Berlin for 3 nights. It has a great location, next to a metro (U-Bahn) station, from where one can easily get to all areas of the city.

Being a 4-star hotel, it is not a bargain, but quite worth the amount they are charging. The room even included a bathtub. Our stay was smooth, and they do offer parking - however, it is not free; the charge is EUR 18 per night, something they like to not mention in advance. Given that it is difficult to find parking in Berlin, and outside parking is not much cheaper, we found ourselves without an option. Especially in order to avoid getting the car damaged by rogue fireworks. I felt they need to improve on some details still though, just to mention those here: - Internet passwords are only valid for one device for up to 24 hours. New passwords need to be obtained from the reception. One would think that for that price per night, they could put together a more convenient system. - Minibar charges are as ridiculously expensive as other hotels of the class, so just buy your drinks outside. The parking charges are too high as well. - The choice in pillows is unsatisfactory, seeing as the usual German pillows are super flat; only one neck support pillow was offered, which was the tiny sausage type.

Sylvain , France
Boutique Hotel i31 Berlin Mitte
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 233 reviews

Traditionally we stay in old world hotels, so was a little hesitant to book the modern Hotel i31 in an old world city, but the reviews swayed us.

So glad we did book, it's a wonderful hotel! Modern, comfortable and charming Hotel i31 places an emphasis on the cozy, and whilst modern and cozy, in hotels at least, don't often go together Hotel i31 manages it perfectly, I'd also add that it it's a quality hotel too, with friendly staff, great bar with excellent bar food and the rooms really are cozy meets cool. Whilst the breakfast is the usual delicious but pricy affair (as are all hotels), around 20 euros, there is a cheaper 5 euro option that offers tea, coffee and croissants which is nice to have as a less expensive option but with all the convenience of eating in the hotel. The free (non alcoholic) mini bar is a nice touch and was heavily used, I'm sure it saved us a small fortune! Location wise there's a U-Bahn 2 minutes walk around the corner that gets you everywhere. Also you have restaurants close by down Friedrichstraße and then lots all along Torstraße which is just off Friedrichstraße. There's a Balzac Coffee shop right by the U-Bahn which is great to get your day going, and if you don't want to pay the 30 euros to get to Tegel airport or from it, then you can easily take the U-Bahn, then a short bus ride to the airport door for a lot less. To plan your public transport journeys I'd recommend the City Mapper app which was a revelation to us. To sum up then Hotel i31 leaves very little to be desired, it manages an unfussy, relaxing yet quality environment as a base to explore Berlin, much more than functional modern it creates it's own little atmosphere, helped along by a peaceful courtyard garden. We'd go back in a heart beat!

I loved this apartment. I booked an Apartment 2. It was so spacious, clean and relaxing I could have easily spent my entire time inside with a book.

The place was in an ideal location for seeing sites. I walked everywhere. The kitchen was basic but provided me with everything I needed to cook which is a cost saver for those travelling alone and there are plenty of grocery stores around for easy convenience. The bed was very comfortable and I love the big tub in the bathroom. The washing machine was a plus. It is an apartment so you will need to bring shampoo, soap etc but they do provide towels. The internet was a good speed and rarely cut out. The place was very clean with sparse contemporary Scandinavian furnishings - much like you would see in Ikea. The place was perfect for my needs. The only negative I found was the dim lighting, especially in the kitchen. The apartment was also easy to get to and from the Schoenefeld Aiport. Just take the Airport Express to Alexanderplatz Station and then the U2 to Mohrenstrabe station (3,20 Euros) and walk up WilhelmStrabe (5 streets) to BehrenStr, turn left and you'll find the info/checkin office on your left. From there they will guide you to your apartment which is a street or two from the office. I found the cost was appropriate to the benefits of having the conveniences of home.

Lots of free things to do as well. I took in the free concert the Berlin Philharmonic performs in the foyer of their Concert Hall every Tuesday at 1 pm. Nice way to spend 45 mins on Tuesday afternoon. The place was packed so you need to get there at around 11:30 to grab a viewing area. The Holocaust Memorial was also a very moving experience and is free although you have the option to donate money as you exit. You can also find interesting theatre in Berlin. And if you're interested in theatre I suggest checking out the Berliner Ensemble, even if you don't speak english this is a company one should see. Maxim Gorki theatre does some performances with English titles but don't expect traditional takes on the contemporary classics they produce. The Berlin Philharmonic is an exceptional evening as well. So many things to do, so many markets, so much shopping, so much culture, so much history. It's definitely a city to check out as it has something for every age.

More about Berlin

Berlin is one of the most famous cities in the world. This modern metropolis is closely associated with its history and tourists will find poignant remnants of the city’s past. It’s been more than two decades since the fall of the famous wall, yet places like the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, and the Reichstag Building are architectural reminders waiting to be explored.

Kurfurstendamm Avenue was at the center of West Germany's financial success, and today this street hosts the best shopping in Berlin. The most famous being Kaufhaus des Westens, Europe's largest department store. Accommodations in this part of Berlin cater to affluent travelers with a taste for luxury.

The best historic hotels in Berlin are tucked into Mitte, where tourists do most of their sightseeing as the museums, cafés, and even the dance clubs of Mitte exude old-world charm. The most convenient accommodation for travelers making quick stopovers is found in the Reinickendorf area where Berlin-Tegel Airport hotels are located.

Berlin's electronic music scene is also one of the most exciting and progressive in the world, from underground bunker parties to large-scale events like the Love Parade.

With efficient transportation, dozens of world-class museums, and upscale dining and fashion, Berlin is the perfect mix of history and culture.

There’s much more to see and learn about Berlin, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

Located just 1 minute's walk away from the famous Checkpoint Charlie interchange on Friedrichstraße and Zimmerstraße, the location of the hotel is perfect for those wishing to explore the city. Just behind the Checkpoint is the Kochstraße U-Bahn station on the U6 line of Berlin's excellent public transport system. From here, you can reach almost all areas of Berlin, and changing lines or transport methods (S-Bahn, Bus or Tram) is simple and painless. The Hotel is modern, fresh and incredibly clean. The rooms are very stylish and the bed is perfect to rest your weary legs and back after a long day exploring. Being a city hotel, the views will not be spectacular, but the large windows let in lots of natural light. My only criticism would be the lack of drink-making facilities. A coffee in the morning would've made things just that little bit more perfect. The hotel itself is quiet and the staff are very attentive and helpful. The free WiFi throughout was a very welcome feature, helping us to plan each day perfectly. We didn't have the hotel breakfast, preferring to venture out in the city to try different things each day. All in all, this was the perfect place to stay and the next time I visit Berlin, I won't be looking anywhere else! This modern metropolis is closely associated with its history and tourists will find poignant remnants of the city’s past. It’s been more than two decades since the fall of the famous wall, yet places like the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie , and the Reichstag Building are architectural reminders waiting to be explored. Kurfurstendamm Avenue was at the center of West Germany's financial success, and today this street hosts the best shopping in Berlin. The most famous being Kaufhaus des Westens, Europe's largest department store. Accommodations in this part of Berlin cater to affluent travelers with a taste for luxury. The best historic hotels in Berlin are tucked into Mitte, where tourists do most of their sightseeing as the museums, cafés, and even the dance clubs of Mitte exude old-world charm. The most convenient accommodation for travelers making quick stopovers is found in the Reinickendorf area where Berlin-Tegel Airport hotels are located. Berlin's electronic music scene is also one of the most exciting and progressive in the world, from underground bunker parties to large-scale events like the Love Parade. With efficient transportation, dozens of world-class museums, and upscale dining and fashion, Berlin is the perfect mix of history and culture. There’s much more to see and learn about Berlin, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
